thread.title: Game 5 lineups: Dodgers hoping to avoid being deGrom-inated again vs. Mets
thread.title_full: Game 5 lineups: Dodgers hoping to avoid being deGrom-inated again vs. Mets

title: Game 5 lineups: Dodgers hoping to avoid being deGrom-inated again vs. Mets
text:
LOS ANGELES -- In Game 1 of this National League Division Series, the New York Mets started right-hander Jacob deGrom.
DeGrom faced 27 Dodgers batters in seven scoreless innings, struck out 13, allowed just five hits and walked a batter. Dodgers hitters looked thoroughly overmatched at times.
They face deGrom again tonight in Game 5 with the season on the line and Dodgers manager Don Mattingly is hopeful seeing deGrom again so soon after that game will help.
"Well, if he's on and he's throwing the ball where he wants and making pitches, it's going to be a difficult day," Mattingly said. "Obviously, the same for Zack (Greinke). If he's able to do that, it could be a difficult day the other way.
"I think personally the more I see a hitter, the more advantage I have. Now, stuff is still stuff. You have to be able to hit it - a 99-mph fastball. So I think, as a hitter, I always felt like as a hitter I have a better feel for him. I've seen it. I've rated the speed. I kind of got a feel for what this guy likes to do."
The Dodgers also point to the four-day layoff between the end of the season and Game 1 of this series as a less-than-ideal way to prepare for a power pitcher such as deGrom. The Dodgers have seen a steady diet of hard-throwers from the Mets in the past four games now.
"I heard some people make mention of that small layoff between the end of the season and Game 1 - it's hard to gear back up for that velocity," Dodgers catcher A.J. Ellis said. "But playing in these games and seeing velocity after velocity after velocity, I do expect us to be maybe a little bit more on time facing somebody like deGrom - which may or may not even matter the way he throws the baseball."
Game 5 lineups:
METS (2-2) 
RF Curtis Granderson
3B David Wright
2B Daniel Murphy
CF Yeonis Cespedes
1B Lucas Duda
C Travis d'Arnaud
LF Michael Conforto
SS Wilmer Flores
RHP Jacob deGrom
DODGERS (2-2) 
2B Howie Kendrick
SS Corey Seager
1B Adrian Gonzalez
3B Justin Turner
RF Andre Ethier
C Yasmani Grandal
LF Kike' Hernandez
CF Joc Pederson
RHP Zack Greinke
